data.text:
This post is about the weather in Amsterdam in January, including average temperatures, precipitation, and tips on packing and sightseeing activities.

Along with being your tour guide, I am also a retired meteorologist. I use my expertise to help you anticipate the weather conditions for this month.

Amsterdam in January tends to be cold and often can be cloudy.

Daytime high temperatures generally will be around 5 C-6 C (in the low 40s F) but a couple of the warmer afternoons can reach up to near 10 C-11 C (50 F).

The record high temperature for Amsterdam in January was 14 C (57 F).

Late night and early morning low temperatures will tend to be about 1 C (in the mid-30s F) but can dip down at times into -5 C to -6 C (the lower 20s F).

You should expect about 11 days this month with early morning temperatures at or below freezing (0 C/32 F).

The record low temperature for Amsterdam during January was -16 C (3 F).

HOW MUCH SUN OR RAIN?

About 20-21 days this month will be mostly cloudy, however, 10-11 days will be sunny or at least partly sunny.

Precipitation normally falls on 8-12 days with 18 days likely to see some fog.

Some snow or ice can occur on about 6 days, however, accumulating snow or ice only occurs on 2-3 days each winter, and heavy snowfalls are rare.

Daylight hours gradually increase from about 7.8 hours on January 1st reaching just over 9 hours by the 31st.

Amsterdam tends to be breezy during January with moderate breezes prevailing at 20-30 kph (13-18 mph) but occasionally freshening to 31-39 kph (19-24 mph) with higher gusts.

WHAT SHOULD I WEAR?

Amsterdam is cold, damp, and breezy in January so do bring warm winter clothes along with a waterproof warm coat or jacket.

Gloves, a scarf, and a hat will also be handy in windy conditions.

You may also wish to bring along an umbrella, a sweater or two, warm socks, winter boots, and perhaps some thermal underwear.
